alert.note: Alert for Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 1:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Coconino County through 145 PM MST... At 1259 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Parks, or 20 miles west of Flagstaff, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph, penny size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Flagstaff, Fort Valley, Bellemont, Timberline, Hutchison Acres, Parks, Lockett Meadow Campground, Raymond Boy Scout Camp, Little Elden Spring Horse Camp and Arizona Snowbowl. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 172 and 190. U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 423 and 425. Highway 180 between mile markers 218 and 248. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim
